summary: SummaryThe MAC Lipglazer Glossy Liner is a softly shiny lip liner that lines, fills and visibly volumizes for fuller-looking lips - all in one easy glide. Glaze on juicy definition or fill in lips all-over with buildable creamy colour.
details: DetailsBenefitsInstantly shines, fills and visibly volumizes for fuller-looking lipsEasy, tug-free applicationLightweight, gel-cream textureSatin-like shineBlendable and buildableNourishingHydrates lipsComfortable and smoothAdds a defined sheen to lipsKey IngredientsMeadowfoam Seed OilJojoba OilItem 2639402How To UseApply to the perimeter of lips for definition or fill in all over to amplify shine.Pair with your favourite M·A·C Lipstick and Lip Gloss to create limitless lip looks.BEFORE LIPSTICK: To naturally define lips, start by outlining the Cupid's bow. Then, switch to the outer corners of upper lips and draw inward until you connect the lines at the centre.To enhance your lips and create a fuller-looking effect, trace along your upper lip line while gradually overlining beyond the natural border of your lips.To create a contoured lip look, choose a shade deeper than your Lipstick to outline lips. Then, fill in the centre of lips with the lighter Lipstick, slightly overlapping with your liner. Blend with a 316S Brush to create a natural-looking gradient.AFTER LIPSTICK: To add extra definition, line lips after applying your Lipstick.WITH LIPGLASS: Outline or fill in lips completely, then layer on Lipglass for a high-shine look.LINER ONLY: Shade and fill in lips.IngredientsPolyglyceryl-2 Triisostearate, Bis-Diglyceryl Polyacyladipate-2, Hydrogenated Polyisobutene, Synthetic Wax, Pentaerythrityl Adipate/Caprate/Caprylate/Heptanoate, Tribehenin, Sorbitan Isostearate, Cetyl Peg/Ppg-10/1 Dimethicone, Bis-Behenyl/Isostearyl/Phytosteryl Dimer Dilinoleyl Dimer Dilinoleate, Limnanthes Alba (Meadowfoam) Seed Oil, Simmondsia Chinensis (Jojoba) Seed Oil, [+/- Titanium Dioxide (CI 77891), Iron Oxides (CI 77491), Iron Oxides (CI 77492), Iron Oxides (CI 77499), Blue 1 Lake (CI 42090), Red 7 Lake (CI 15850), Red 28 Lake (CI 45410), Yellow 5 Lake (CI 19140), Yellow 6 Lake (CI 15985)].Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Apply to the perimeter of lips for definition or fill in all over to amplify shine.Pair with your favourite M·A·C Lipstick and Lip Gloss to create limitless lip looks.BEFORE LIPSTICK: To naturally define lips, start by outlining the Cupid's bow. Then, switch to the outer corners of upper lips and draw inward until you connect the lines at the centre.To enhance your lips and create a fuller-looking effect, trace along your upper lip line while gradually overlining beyond the natural border of your lips.To create a contoured lip look, choose a shade deeper than your Lipstick to outline lips. Then, fill in the centre of lips with the lighter Lipstick, slightly overlapping with your liner. Blend with a 316S Brush to create a natural-looking gradient.AFTER LIPSTICK: To add extra definition, line lips after applying your Lipstick.WITH LIPGLASS: Outline or fill in lips completely, then layer on Lipglass for a high-shine look.LINER ONLY: Shade and fill in lips.

reviews.headline: Dusky warm auburn brown
reviews.comments: Love love love! This lip liner is a dream to use - it goes on smooth, it looks/feels creamy but is still firm so you can be precise. You need this one!

reviews.headline: It's ok
reviews.comments: It is much less glossy than I expected. Satin finish. Not a long wear time. I would probably return if it was more convenient.  A lot to pay for a mediocre product.

reviews.headline: Perfect Glide
reviews.comments: I got this lip liner for a specific look I was trying to achieve. I have several brown liners but this one is definitely a new favorite! It was very easy to blend compared to other liners I've used. The only downside is once applying gloss, it was hard to do a touchup and see the difference. I reccommend putting on dry lips

reviews.headline: Where's the shine
reviews.comments: Dont know if i got a bad batch, but my lip liner just looked and felt like regular lip liner. Wasnt a shine and just looked regular.

Gloss? Liner? Lip Magic? Yes Please

faceoff_positive.comments: I received this product for free from Topbox Marketing for testing and review purposes.  I've always loved a multitasking lip product, and the MAC LipGlazer Glossy Liner in Marrakesh absolutely delivers. This warm terracotta-brown shade is rich, sultry, and universally flattering—it instantly elevates any look, whether you're going for soft glam or a bold statement. The texture? Chef's kiss. It's that perfect hybrid between a creamy liner and a high-shine gloss. It glides on effortlessly without dragging, and the color payoff is impressive for such a glossy formula. You get definition and shine in one stroke, which means fewer products to juggle. What really stood out for me was the comfort. It's not sticky at all (a big win), and it keeps my lips feeling smooth and hydrated throughout the day. The shine lasts longer than expected for a gloss-liner hybrid, and even as it fades, it leaves a beautiful stain behind. Marrakesh is that kind of shade that makes you feel powerful—like you've got your life together, even if you're just running errands in sweats. I've worn it solo, paired it with a matte lipstick underneath, and even dabbed it over balm for a more diffused look—it's versatile like that. If you're looking for something that brings color, comfort, and a little attitude, I highly recommend giving this one a go. MAC nailed it with this launch.
faceoff_positive.headline: Amazing

faceoff_negative.comments:
I received this product for free from Topbox Marketing for testing and review purposes.

I tested the MAC LipGlazer Glossy Liner in Candy Yum Yum. While I was excited to try it, I have to say it didn't quite live up to my expectations. The formula has a nice, moisturizing feel—which I appreciated—but overall, I've used drugstore liners that performed better in terms of pigmentation and precision. The shade Candy Yum Yum also wasn't quite right for me; it felt a bit too bold and not as wearable as I hoped. I wanted to love it, but it just didn't blow me away.
faceoff_negative.headline: Glossy But Not A Game Changer
